Name: Native-VLAN
Usage: Use VLAN 2 as native VLAN instead ofdefault VLAN (1)

Name: OOB-MGMT-VLAN
Usage: Out-of-band management VLAN to connect management ports for various devices

Name: IB-MGMT-VLAN
Usage: In-band management VLAN utilized for all in-band management connectivity for example ESXi hosts or VM management

Name: OCP-MGMT
Usage: OCP management traffic VLAN used in place of VM-Traffic VLAN

Name: NFS-VLAN
Usage: NFS VLAN for mounting datastores in ESXi servers for VMs
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: iSCSI-A
Usage: iSCSI-A path for storage traffic including boot-from-san traffic
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: iSCSI-B
Usage: iSCSI-B path for storage traffic including boot-from-san traffic
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: NVMe-TCP-A
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: NVMe-TCP-B
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: vMotion
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: OCP-NFS
Usage: NFS VLAN for OCP persistent storage and OCP cluster and support VMs
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: OCP-NVMe-TCP-A
Usage: NVMe-TCP-A path when using NVMe-TCP for persistent storage
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets

Name: OCP-NVMe-TCP-B
Usage: NVMe-TCP-B path when using NVMe-TCP for persistent storage
IP Gateway: IP gateway is not needed since no routing is required for these subnets
